IntApp Expands Sales Team
In 2011, IntApp increased our sales team to provide coverage for mid-size firms worldwide. In October, we announced the addition of Richard Hill, as Account Executive for the UK. Since then, we have continued to expand our team of Account Executives.
Catherine Phan-Dang is a familiar face for many IntApp customers, having served as a Project Manager since 2010. In fall of 2011, Catherine transitioned to the role of Account Executive for the Northwest and Canada region.
Prior to joining IntApp, Catherine held positions in account management and project management at several companies, primarily in the software industry.
Catherine can be reached at Catherine.PhanDang@intapp.com.
Brooke Barber is another familiar face for many Time Builder customers. She joined IntApp in early 2011 as a Customer Success Manager. In fall of 2011, Brooke transitioned to the role of Account Executive for the Mid-Atlantic and Southeast regions.
Prior to joining IntApp, Brooke held positions in project management and account management at several companies across various sectors, including ADERANT.
Brooke can be reached at Brooke.Barber@intapp.com.
We are also pleased to welcome a new face, but industry veteran, Pam Snyder. Pam joined IntApp in November 2011 as Account Executive for the Central region of the United States.
Pam has extensive experience in the legal industry, serving as a Regional Sales Manager at Elite for nearly 6 years. Prior to that, Pam held the position of President for LDSI, an international provider of a complete range of litigation support solutions, for 16 years.
Pam can be reached at Pam.Snyder@intapp.com.
General Release of Time Builder 4.7
Last quarter we announced the availability of Time Builder 4.7 as part of our Early Adopter Program. This major upgrade includes the availability of the Time Builder Mobile Application, which allows lawyers to enter and submit time entries on the go from their iPad and iPhone devices.
Thanks to the feedback from our Early Adopters, we have made several improvements to the Time Builder Mobile Application and are happy to now offer this release on a broader scale. If you would like more information about the Time Builder Mobile Application, please contact your Managing Director or Account Executive.
Introducing Wall Builder 5
We are very excited to announce the release of Wall Builder 5. This major release is focused on improving the ease-of-use for end users and optimizing performance. New features include:
-a brand new user interface and improved user experience
-an improved wall creation wizard
-ability to clone a wall
-increased speed
-real-time security status
-simplified installation, management and upgrades
Several firms are already using this version, and preliminary feedback has been extremely positive. If you would like more information about Wall Builder 5, please contact your Managing Director or Account Executive. For the latest news, visit the Risk Practice section of our Customer Community.
Wall Builder Momentum Continues
The 2011 ILTA Technology Survey identifies IntApp Wall Builder as the most adopted confidentiality software product for law firms. Report data show that 72% of large law firms (700 or more lawyers) using commercial software to enforce ethical screens to secure access to confidential information have standardized on IntApp Wall Builder. Of firms with 350 to 699 lawyers using commercial confidentiality management software, 67% have chosen Wall Builder, and of firms with 150-349 lawyers using commercial confidentiality management software, 55% have chosen Wall Builder. For more information, visit http://www.intapp.com/company/news20111107b.html.
IntApp Client Success Recognized
Norton Rose Group won the 2011 Lawtech Award in the security and risk management category for deploying IntApp Wall Builder to enhance confidentiality controls and track compliance across the organization.
Patty Fitzpatrick, Director of Practice Management at Katten Muchin Rosenman, was honored as a finalist in the 2011 ILTA Distinguished Peer Awards in the "Risk and Records Management Champion" category for deploying IntApp Wall Builder to centrally control access to client confidential matters and track compliance across the firm.
Perry Lawrence, Senior Data Integration Architect at O'Melveny & Myers, was also honored as a finalist in the 2011 ILTA Distinguished Peer Awards in the "Emerging Technologies Champion" category for his work using IntApp Integration Builder to connect the firm's cloud-based HR software with other internal systems and business processes. He says that by using Integration Builder, the firm accomplished the project in one-tenth the time they had originally projected.
IntApp Partner Program
IntApp is excited to announce a new Integration Builder development partner, Wilson Legal Solutions. Wilson Legal is providing development capabilities and solutions around IntApp Integration Builder. IntApp is always expanding its partner portfolio to help provide clients with more development options for Integration Builder. Additionally, asking your partners to leverage Integration Builder can help you both standardize and maintain any custom development as well as help you see even more value out of your existing investments.
About Wilson Legal Solutions: Wilson Legal Solutions helps law firms maximize the benefits of technology to reach new levels of operational efficiency and profitability. The company applies deep technical expertise, hands-on software experience, and best-practice insight to enable clients to leverage their investment in practice management and business intelligence software. For information visit www.wilsonlegalsol.com.

Recent Webinars
We hosted several webinars this fall and have many more in the works.
Integration Webinars
Neal Vora, head of IntApp's Integration Practice, hosted an Integration Builder webinar featuring a client case study by Kegler Brown. The webinar focused on integrating the cloud into firm systems and processes.
Risk Webinars
Brian Lynch, Director of IntApp's Risk Practice, hosted two Risk Roundtable webinars, bringing together industry experts to discuss current trends in law firm risk management. Topics covered were outside counsel guidelines and insider risk. We'd like to extend a big thank you to our panel of speakers for sharing their expertise.
Revenue Webinars
Eldean Ward, head of IntApp's Revenue Practice, hosted a Time Builder webinar, featuring a client case study by Dykema. The webinar highlighted the firm's success with the software, particularly the high lawyer satisfaction rate, 80% adoption among timekeepers, and an additional 1.4% of revenue to the firm's bottom line.
